Package com.example.happymeals

Class InputValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.happymeals.InputValidator
  • public class InputValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to minimize the risk of save failure within the database. It consists of methods to check all possible input components: EditText, Spinner. Besides just these objects, it checks based on the type of data as well: string, number, date, etc. Concurrently, it builds an error string which can be used to display to the user to inform them of which fields they are missing/need to fix. For a specific view, it will instantiate a InputValidator object and each input component will be checked using its corresponding method (checkText(EditText, String), checkDate(EditText), etc.). After all have been checked, getErrors() will return null if there were no errors; otherwise, it will return an error string consisting of fields that need to be fixed.

      InputValidator()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void checkDate​(android.widget.EditText date)
      Adds to the error string if improper format / no date provided; does nothing otherwise
      void checkNum​(android.widget.EditText field, java.lang.String name)
      Adds to the error string if the number is not an integer greater than or equal to 0.
      void checkSpinner​(android.widget.Spinner spinner, java.lang.String name)
      Adds to the error string if the spinner does not have anything selected (should not occur based on our implementation).
      void checkText​(android.widget.EditText text, java.lang.String name)
      Adds to the error string if empty; does nothing otherwise.
      java.lang.String getErrors()
      This function should be called ONLY when all components have been checked with the previous methods.

        public void checkSpinner​(android.widget.Spinner spinner,

      • getErrors

        public java.lang.String getErrors()
        This function should be called ONLY when all components have been checked with the previous methods.
        Returns:
        null if there were no errors; otherwise, it returns a String representing the error / input fields that need to be fixed by the user to proceed further (to be used by a InputErrorFragment.
